title: Ticket #3214: No easy way to extract forensic info from User/Event Log
description:
We are trying to prepare ourself to react to the event of one of our users turning malicious.
One of the basic things we would need to determine in such event is where the jobs of such a user have been running.

condor_history is of course not enough, since the job may have started several time due to preemption.

We are thus planning to rely on the EventLog.
Since we have a portal Condor installation, we fully control user submission. So the submit node can be considered un-compromised.

The problem now is how to parse the information out of the EventLog.

condor_userlog
seems the natural choice, but lacks two important features:
  1. No support for -constraint
  2. It only shows the hostname. Since we are a glidein shop, this information is not really useful; we would need to print out other information, like the GLIDEIN_Identity.

I thus propose to extend 

condor_userlog
to give us the information we need.

2014-Aug-04 15:29:56 by tannenba:
So above problem statement says
  1. This is a portal environment, where job submission is controlled ans trusted, and
  2. Like to know where the jobs of a user have been running, and condor_history is of course not enough, since the job may have started several time due to preemption.

So couldn't the job submit file simply use a very large match_list_length or job_machine_attrs_history_length along with condor_history be used? Not that I have an issue with what the patch does (although patch appears to maybe be implemented using some boost libraries that are not allowed as per HTCondor coding standard...).

2014-Aug-04 15:35:27 by sfiligoi:
Perhaps one could add a long match_list_length, but that would significantly increase the ClassAd size. We do not really want to load the Schedd any more than needed.

Plus, one wants to preserve way more than just the machine name, making the cost even higher.
